text:
Lots of flumine modules contain this at the top:

```logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)```
What is the best way to send log all of them to a single file?

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

elements.text: Lots of flumine modules contain this at the top:
What is the best way to send log all of them to a single file?

text: Add a handler to the `'flumine'` logger
Here is a good start, scroll down for example in how to include a library, also see <https://liampauling.github.io/flumine/advanced/#logging|here> to setup the jsonlogger

elements.text: Here is a good start, scroll down for example in how to include a library, also see

text:
<!here> hey guys, I’m getting certificate_verify_failed error all of a sudden when trying to connect to streaming. (it’s the same code that’s been running for a while and ran this morning; and the certificate shouldn’t expire until next year) 

has anyone had that before? what could that be due?

elements.text: hey guys, I’m getting certificate_verify_failed error all of a sudden when trying to connect to streaming. (it’s the same code that’s been running for a while and ran this morning; and the certificate shouldn’t expire until next year)
has anyone had that before? what could that be due?

text: main website had an ssl error too... but that seems to be fixed now

elements.text: main website had an ssl error too... but that seems to be fixed now

text: <!here> betfair doing load testing, causing issues, should be fixed shortly

elements.text: betfair doing load testing, causing issues, should be fixed shortly

text: It actually just looks like the issue is with verifying the certificate at the login endpoint

elements.text: It actually just looks like the issue is with verifying the certificate at the login endpoint

text: Yeah seems there was an overlap with the load testing and a certificate update at ~10:25

elements.text: Yeah seems there was an overlap with the load testing and a certificate update at ~10:25

text: great, cheers gents! all working as well :+1:

elements.text: great, cheers gents! all working as well

text: I thought I was the one load testing

elements.text: I thought I was the one load testing

text: Streaming kept working for me fine, but keep_alive NG call failed at 10:28, it succeded at 10:29 though :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Streaming kept working for me fine, but keep_alive NG call failed at 10:28, it succeded at 10:29 though

text: Probably a silly question but when streaming and hitting the limit of the number of markets (`SUBSCRIPTION_LIMIT_EXCEEDED`) - is that limit per stream that is opened, or across all streams?

elements.text: Probably a silly question but when streaming and hitting the limit of the number of markets (
) - is that limit per stream that is opened, or across all streams?

text: Thanks, and I guess the obvious question coming is, is there a limit to the number of streams that can then be opened?
